oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Atlas of the city of Nashville 1908. [Plate 14B]
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: 1 map; 58 x 75 cm. A plat map of downtown Nashville, Tennessee and the surrounding area, originally published in 1908 by G. M. Hopkins Company, showing the various buildings, landscapes, acreage, and street routes for several blocks bound by Howerton and Sycamore Street, west of Third Street, Shelby Avenue, and Sixth Street. Original building structures are depicted on the map, such as Seventh Day Adventist Memorial Church, East Side Improvement Company, Tulip Street Methodist Episcopal Church, Fire Engine House no. 4, Woodland Street Presbyterian Church, East Side Post Office (referred to as East Station Post Office in the 1908 City Directory), St. Anne's Protestant Episcopal Church, St. Columba's Catholic Church and School (labeled as St. Columbia on the map), and Little Sisters of the Poor. This plat map is reproduced from the source: Atlas of the city of Nashville, Tennessee : from official records, private plans and actual surveys, G. M. Hopkins, [Philadelphia, Pa.] 1908. Scale 150 feet to an inch. The original dimensions of the map, in the atlas publication: 15 1/2 x 22 3/4 in. (i.e. 58 x 75 cm.)
